intro: Selliguea espinosae, commonly known as the Spiny Selliguea, is a species of liverwort found in arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaf structures. The plant typically grows on rock surfaces or soil in dry environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its morphology includes a thallus that is often lobed and covered with small, pointed projections. This liverwort plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for other organisms in its ecosystem.
